channel.description: Recent content in ü™¥ A Wild Garden on

item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, here’s exactly how to do that!

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: Hosting on GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

[!WARN] Under development. An ongoing note on college, extracting value from an institution that seeks to exploit you, finding what college is actually good for, and the feeling of agency by shaping your course of study within constraints.
One of my favorite things to talk about right now is language. Language matters because our intentional use in understanding ourselves and the world is one of the greatest expressions of agency.
Janet Abette Key Ideas: Both an experiemental project in packet switching technology + practical resource sharing endevor with implications of a “survivable” communication network.
I’m 23. I have the added benefit that my age corresponds to the new year (except for the two weeks between my birthday and the start of the new year).

item.title: 4000 Weeks: Time Management For Mortals
item.description: My tongue-in-cheek one-liner for this book is the anti-productivity anti-self-help productivity self-help book I didn’t know I needed. Oliver Burkeman combines ancient ideas with relatable, 21st-century-specific anxiety-ridden anecdotes into a lucid meditation on our difficult yet truly inescapable relationship with time.

item.title: Beyond From and Content: Beneath Interpretation
item.description: It is only shallow people who do not judge by appearances. The mystery of the world is the visible, not the invisible.

item.title: Callouts
item.description: Callout support Quartz supports the same Admonition-callout syntax as Obsidian. This includes 12 Distinct callout types (each with several aliases) Collapsable callouts See documentation on supported types and syntax here.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Find Rhythm. Not Momentum
item.description: Momentum measures how hard it is to stop something once it is in motion. The metaphor of momentum is used (and abused!

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: Independent Study Writing Grave Yard
item.description: Snippets of writing that I wanted to hold on to: Power users do not necessarily need to be able to “code,” although many might learn if they need.

item.title: Language Matters
item.description: Because it does, and my dear friend Isabelle Pride says so. Jokes. But it does. Most fundamentally. Language is how we construct reality and our self-concept.

item.title: Living Book Commentaries
item.description: We’ve all been told and, in turn, tell ourselves to “read more.” I’m skeptical. We’ve all met people who have (claimed to) read everything.

item.title: Modern Dance Meditations - Physicality & Self Expression
item.description: Ongoing reflections of a first-time dancer taking introductory courses in Modern dance. One of the best parts about being an undergraduate is the introductory classes, taught by masters of their craft who know how to teach.

item.title: Non-Violent Communication: A Language of Life
item.description: By: Marshall Rosenberg First Published January 1st, 1999 A Living Book Commentary: Expressing and Receiving Gratitude Example of lousy gratitude: “You are brilliant” - there is no information here.

item.title: Obsidian Tips and Tricks
item.description: Syntax Foot notes: 1 2 3 4 text that has the footnote[^FN_NAME] (after new-line at bottom of page) [^FN_NAME]: Collaborating on Obsidian: Collaborative Sync - requires that all participants have Hack: VS Code Live Share is the best

item.title: Power & Power User
item.description: A Prospectus for an independent study and thesis for my senior year, originating from an incredible seminar on Information‚ÄîComputing‚ÄîInfrastructure(History GR8479) taught by professor Matthew Jones in the Fall, of 2022.

item.title: Process Doc. Power User Study
item.description: A growing stack on the notes to self from feedback office hours and all the miscellaneous shit involved in an independent study/thesis, documented here.

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: ‚Äú[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.

item.title: Questions
item.description: What makes some a “mystic”? Benjamin, Simone Weil, philosophers, thinkers, and writers I love who are often labeled as “mystics.

item.title: Search
item.description: Quartz supports two modes of searching through content. Full-text Full-text search is the default in Quartz. It produces results that exactly match the search query.

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Jacky Zhao’s Garden Scaling Synthesis - A hypertext research notebook AWAGMI Intern Notes Shihyu’s PKM Chloe’s Garden SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden Siyang’s Courtyard If you want to see your own on here, submit a Pull Request adding yourself to this file!

item.title: The Closed World: Computers and the Politics of Discourse in Cold War America
item.description: Book [[Notes]]: On the dissertation book of Paul N. Edwards Preface: “The Closed World emphasizes linkages and problems ignored or downplayed by most extant texts.

item.title: The Inescapability of Gettier Cases
item.description: Ever since Gettier famously highlighted a fault in the concept of knowledge by showing justified, true, belief (JTB) as jointly insufficient for knowledge, there have been many attempts to fix it.

item.title: The Participant
item.description: By: Christopher Kelty Ongoing Book Notes: Participation is a “poorly mapped” territory. Often seen as unquestionably ‘good’. Participation spread. Mill viewed it as a “school of democracy”, and Lincoln codified it in the democracy of the late nineteenth century with his “of the people, by the people and for the people.

item.title: The Political Programmer
item.description: A Political Analysis of the Modern Means of Producing Technology based on Walter Benjamin’s Theory of Art and Artist [!

item.title: The Primacy of the Physical in Ibn Tufayl's Philosophical Tale
item.description: What is a human without society? To some, the question is nonsensical; to others, none is more important. Because, for the latter group, the hypothetical isolated human in what later European philosophers call ‚Äúthe state of nature,‚Äù shows us how we really are.

item.title: Three Ethical Moments in Debian
item.description: Ongoing notes on Gabriella (Biella) Coleman’s dissertation on the dynamic ethical and motives of Free/Open Source Software (F/OSS) developers through a case study of Debian.

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)

item.title: Updating
item.description: Haven’t updated Quartz in a while and want all the cool new optimizations? On Unix/Mac systems you can run the following command for a one-line update!
